data.text: @klusterfukked @thehoffather I think there are a lot of variables - one member in a home gets it and two others don’t. Obviously folks with health problems had a much higher likelihood of getting it and much worse outcomes.

@SKOLfromSeattle @thehoffather I have read papers/studies saying we may have crossover protection from other past corona viruses we have come in contact with?That might explain why I never got it despite being exposed to covid. Or like my son who has proven T cell immunity never even knew he had it..

@klusterfukked @thehoffather I don’t think we put all our eggs in one basket - vaccines were created and multiple options have been created to treat once infected. Not saying natural immunity isn’t recognized but it requires getting COVID, which has killed almost a million people in the US.

@SKOLfromSeattle @thehoffather Natural immunity needs to be studied and recognized. Therapeutics need to be developed and offered. Shots need to be improved. We can get there if we don’t put all our eggs in one vaccine basket.

@SKOLfromSeattle @thehoffather The vaccinated in my town went out unmasked and celebrated and little did they know that little sniffle they had was covid and they ran around spreading it. No negative test required like the unvaxed to go places or in schools.Should of tested everyone regardless of vax status

@SKOLfromSeattle @thehoffather Ok when the vaccine first rolled out we were locked down and cases were not as high.once vaxxed people were told it was safe to unmask and go about your business again cases shot up especially amongst the vaxxed. This was Well before omicron came to the scene! Cont.

@klusterfukked @thehoffather We have all of that at this point. But isn’t it better to not get COVID or get much milder symptoms than get hospitalized or die? We have seen almost a million deaths in 2 years from this…

@klusterfukked @thehoffather The vaccine worked pretty much as advertised before Omicron. There is generally a reduction in viral load in someone vaxxed vs unvaxxed. So even if a vaxxed person passes it on, it’s being diminished. And that is why the vaxxed generally have milder symptoms and better outcomes.

@klusterfukked @thehoffather I sent you the graphs a little while ago. When you’re 5x-10x less likely to go to the hospital or die from COVID, that’s for the greater good. 

https://t.co/qp3JeJBhPQ
@SKOLfromSeattle @thehoffather We should have a multi layered approach migation, effective vaccines for the vulnerable and effective therapeutics.
